communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning David Lynch (January 20, 1946 – January 16, 2025), famed American artist and film director (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Lynch)

If, famed  any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

Please see the following public news article as proof of death: https://apnews.com/article/david-lynch-dies-9107f3ce0b4dd49dbe3dc2ae3c09ed59

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Offense Level Data
Please provide offense level data for incidents occurring within a one-mile radius of 312 Herbert Street, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Incident number, Occurrence date, Occurrence time, Reported date, Reported time, Offense description, UCR/NIBRS code, Other offense code/statutes (where applicable), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business/location name if available, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

2. CFS Level Data
Please provide call-for-service (CFS) data for calls within a one-mile radius of 312 Herbert Street, Cedartown, GA, during the period of December 31, 2021, through December 31, 2024. The data should include, at a minimum, the following fields: Call number, Call date, Call time, Call type (if coded, please include code definitions), Call type description (if coded, please include code definitions), Disposition (No Action Taken, Gone Upon Arrival, etc.), Address (if possible, original address not aggregated to block level), Business name (where applicable), Beat, Latitude, Longitude.

I request that this data be provided in CSV, XLS, or XLSX format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Karli DeBlois
